page.title: 18ATTITUDES
page.content: Some general attitudes: Of the {weather:}Everything balances out in the end. Bad winters are followed by good summers, droughts by wet autumns. {Prospects for the young:}Bad, unless you want to spend a life picking fruit and potatoes.{Farming:}Less workers all the time and more machines. Some of the economics of farming based on EEC rules make no sense at all , but are very profitable.'If I didn't take advantage of them, the next man would'.'Some towns folk think that we are monsters destroying nature and ripping up the landscape, but we live in it and love it'.{Attitudes of Outsiders:'}They think we lead an idyllic existance, a slow quiet life. If they realised what effort we have to put into such things as taking the children to school, or Granny to the docters'.
